title: Which technologies can actually help learning? - Quora

response.answer_text: Here is a list of technologies that can assist in learning effectiveness: 1. Flash and HTML5. They are the fundamental tools required to create engaging courseware. 2. Mobile devices and tablets such as iPad make learning fun, interactive, and pervasive. 3. Augmented Reality apps can bring to life static content and images making learning exciting and memorable. They can also serve as powerful performance support tools. 4. Virtual Worlds can provide a risk free environment for learning and socializing with fellow students and teachers. 5. Videos are killer learning tools. Searchable videos can give you instant access to knowledge and learning. 6. Content curation platforms can save lots of time by consolidating all the relevant information to jump start learning.

I believe it is a really exciting time for learning. There is great technology out there to facilitate learning! Mobile devices are a really great tool to enable learning (iPad, Galaxy tab, etc.) nowadays you can find apps for pretty much any type of knowledge you can think of. This app is a great example of an interactive museum anyone can be excited about:http://www.museumoflondon.org.uk/Resources/app/Streetmuseum-Londinium/index.htmlIf you don't have access to mobile devices or tablets, content created with traditional eLearning authoring software combined with rich media (videos from youtube, vimeo, photos and graphics from royalty free stock sites like shutterstock and istockphoto) can really deliver powerful learning. In the end, what is important in my opinion is to deliver highly engaging and interactive type of teaching / instruction, one you can relate to. The technology you use can only just enhance that experience, but technology alone will not deliver it!
